013    package net.sf.oval.guard;
014    
015    import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
016    import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017    import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018    import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019    import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020    
021    /**
022     * This annotation needs to be applied to classes where 
023     * OVal's programming by contract features shall be used.<br>
024     * <br>
025     * The GuardAspect will weave the required AOP code into all
026     * classes annotated with @Guarded.
027     * 
028     * @author Sebastian Thomschke
029     */
030    @Documented
031    @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
032    @Target(ElementType.TYPE)
033    public @interface Guarded
034    {
035            /**
036             * Automatically apply field constraints to the corresponding parameters of
037             * constructors declared within the same class.
038             * A corresponding parameter is a parameter with the same name and type as the field.
039             */
040            boolean applyFieldConstraintsToConstructors() default false;
041    
042            /**
043             * Automatically apply field constraints to the single parameter of the corresponding 
044             * setter methods declared within the same class.
045             * A corresponding setter method is a method following the JavaBean convention and
046             * its parameter has as the same type as the field.
047             */
048            boolean applyFieldConstraintsToSetters() default false;
049    
050            /**
051             * Declares if parameter values of constructors and methods are expected to be not null.
052             * This can be weakened by using the @net.sf.oval.constraint.exclusion.Nullable annotation on specific parameters.
053             */
054            boolean assertParametersNotNull() default false;
055    
056            /**
057             * Declares if invariants are automatically checked after constructor execution and 
058             * prior and after calls to non-private methods.
059             */
060            boolean checkInvariants() default true;
061    }
